meanings.definition: Excessively smooth or smug in a way that is perceived as insincere or false.
meanings.sent1: The salesman's unctuousness made customers feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: Her unctuousness was evident in the way she complimented everyone insincerely.
meanings.sent3: His unctuousness was so over-the-top that it almost seemed like a parody.
meanings.sent4: The politician's unctuousness dripped from his every word, masking his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The unctuousness of the character in the play was so exaggerated that it became comical.

meanings.definition: Characterized by excessive flattery or ingratiating behavior.
meanings.sent1: The unctuousness of the host was off-putting to the guests.
meanings.sent2: She used unctuousness to win favor with her boss.
meanings.sent3: His unctuousness was so transparent that no one believed his compliments.
meanings.sent4: The unctuousness of the salesperson was like a sugary coating over a bitter pill.
meanings.sent5: Her unctuousness was like a mask she wore to hide her true feelings.

meanings.definition: Having a greasy or oily texture.
meanings.sent1: The unctuousness of the salad dressing made the salad taste rich.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic's hands were covered in unctuousness after working on the car.
meanings.sent3: The unctuousness of the lotion left a slick residue on her skin.
meanings.sent4: The unctuousness of the hair product gave her hair a glossy sheen.
meanings.sent5: The unctuousness of the food made it slide down his throat easily.
